data.Sentence_cn: 课文46  业余爱好
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 46 Hobbies

data.Sentence_cn: 根据作者的说法，谁是“天赐之子”?
data.Sentence: Who, according to the author, are 'Fortune's favoured children'?

data.Sentence_cn: 一位天才的美国心理学家曾经说过“烦恼是感情的发作，
data.Sentence: A gifted American psychologist has said, 'Worry is a spasm of the emotion;

data.Sentence_cn: 此时脑子纠缠住了某种东西又不肯松手。”
data.Sentence: the mind catches hold of something and will not let it go.'

data.Sentence_cn: 在这种情况下，你又和头脑争吵让它松手是无济于事的。
data.Sentence: It is useless to argue with the mind in this condition.

data.Sentence_cn: 这种意志越是强烈，这种尝试越是徒劳。
data.Sentence: The stronger the will, the more futile the task.

data.Sentence_cn: 你只能缓和而巧纱地让另一种东西进入痉挛僵持的头脑中。
data.Sentence: One can only gently insinuate something else into its convulsive grasp.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果选得合适，而且的确受到别的领域的情趣的启迪，
data.Sentence: And if this something else is rightly chosen, if it is really attended by the illumination of another field of interest,

data.Sentence_cn: 那么渐渐地，往往也是很顺利地，原先不适当的紧张就会松弛下来，恢复和修整的过程就会开始。
data.Sentence: gradually, and often quite swiftly, the old undue grip relaxes and the process of recuperation and repair begins.

data.Sentence_cn: 因此，对一个从事社会活动的人来说，培养一种业余爱好和各种新的兴趣是关等重要的作法。
data.Sentence: The cultivation of a hobby and new forms of interest is therefore a policy of the first importance to a public man.

data.Sentence_cn: 但这并非一日之功，也不是单凭一蹴而就的事。
data.Sentence: But this is not a business that can be undertaken in a day or swiftly improvised by a mere command of the will.

data.Sentence_cn: 精神上多种情趣的培养是一个长期的过程。
data.Sentence: The growth of alternative mental interests is a long process.

data.Sentence_cn: 必然需要从选良种做起，然后将其植入肥沃的土地，
data.Sentence: The seeds must be carefully chosen; they must fall on good ground;

data.Sentence_cn: 还需要勤勉地护理，才能在需要的时候可随手摘取充满生机的果实。
data.Sentence: they must be sedulously tended, if the vivifying fruits are to be at hand when needed.

data.Sentence_cn: 一个人要想真正感到幸福和平安，至少应有两三种爱好，而且都比较实际。
data.Sentence: To be really happy and really safe, one ought to have at least two or three hobbies, and they must all be real.

data.Sentence_cn: 到了晚年才开始说：“我会对这些人或那个人发生兴趣”，
data.Sentence: It is no use starting late in life to say: 'I will take an interest in this or that.'

data.Sentence_cn: 已没有用了。这种愿望只能加剧精神紧张。
data.Sentence: Such an attempt only aggravates the strain of mental effort.

data.Sentence_cn: 一个人可能会获得与其日常工作无关的某些课题的渊博知识，而没有从中得到什么实益或宽慰。
data.Sentence: A man may acquire great knowledge of topics unconnected with his daily work, and yet get hardly any benefit or relief.

data.Sentence_cn: 干你所喜欢的事是没有用的，你喜欢你所干的事。
data.Sentence: It is no use doing what you like; you have got to like what you do.

data.Sentence_cn: 泛泛地说，人可以分为3类：
data.Sentence: Broadly speaking, human beings may be divided into three classes:

data.Sentence_cn: 劳累至死的人、忧虑至死的人、无聊至死的人。
data.Sentence: those who are toiled to death, those who are worried to death, and those who are bored to death.

data.Sentence_cn: 对于劳动者而言，
data.Sentence: It is no use offering the manual labourer,

data.Sentence_cn: 他们流汗出力干了一周苦活，让他们在星期六下午再踢足球或打垒球是不合适的；
data.Sentence: tired out with a hard week's sweat and effort the chance of playing a game of football or baseball on Saturday afternoon.

data.Sentence_cn: 同样，对于为严肃的公务操劳或烦恼了6天的政界人士、专业人员、商人来说也是无益的，
data.Sentence: It is no use inviting the politician or the professional or business man, who has been working or worrying about serious things for six days,

data.Sentence_cn: 如果在周未再让他们为琐事而动脑子和忧虑。
data.Sentence: to work or worry about trifling things at the weekend.

data.Sentence_cn: 至于那些能任意支配一切的“可怜的人”，
data.Sentence: As for the unfortunate people who can command everything they want,

data.Sentence_cn: 他们能够恣意妄为，能染指一切追求的目标。
data.Sentence: who can gratify every caprice and lay their hands on almost every object of desire -- for them a new pleasure a new excitement is only an additional satiation.

data.Sentence_cn: 但这是徒劳的。他们到处奔乱跑，企图以闲聊和乱窜来摆脱无聊对他们的报复。
data.Sentence: In vain they rush frantically round from place to place, trying to escape from avenging boredom by mere clatter and motion.

data.Sentence_cn: 对他们来说，用某种形式的纪律约束他们一下才能有希望使他们走上正道。
data.Sentence: For them discipline in one form or another is the most hopeful path.

data.Sentence_cn: 也可以这样说，理智的，勤劳的、有用的人可以分为两类：
data.Sentence: It may also be said that rational, industrious, useful human beings are divided into two classes:

data.Sentence_cn: 第一类是他分清工作是工作，娱乐是娱乐的人；
data.Sentence: first, those whose work is work and whose pleasure is pleasure;

data.Sentence_cn: 第二类人的工作和娱乐是一回事。
data.Sentence: and secondly, those whose work and pleasure are one.

data.Sentence_cn: 这两类人当中，第一类人是大多数，他们能够得到补偿。
data.Sentence: Of these the former are the majority. They have their compensations.

data.Sentence_cn: 在办公室或工厂里长时间工作给他们带来了酬劳，
data.Sentence: The long hours in the office or the factory bring with them as their reward,

data.Sentence_cn: 这不仅是谋生的手段，而且还带来了寻找乐趣的强烈欲望，那怕是最简单的、最低等的乐趣。
data.Sentence: not only the means of sustenance, but a keen appetite for pleasure even in its simplest and most modest forms.

data.Sentence_cn: 但是，命运之神的宠儿是第二类人，
data.Sentence: But Fortune's favoured children belong to the second class.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们的生活是一种自然的和谐，
data.Sentence: Their life is a natural harmony.

data.Sentence_cn: 对他们来说，工作时间总不会太长，
data.Sentence: For them the working hours are never long enough.

data.Sentence_cn: 每天都是假日，而通常的假期来到，他们却惋惜这假期强制打断了他们埋头从事的工作。
data.Sentence: Each day is a holiday, and ordinary holidays, when they come, are grudged as enforced interruptions in an absorbing vocation.

data.Sentence_cn: 然而对这两种人来说，都需要换一换脑子，改变一下气氛，转移一下注意力，这是不可缺少的。
data.Sentence: Yet to both classes, the need of an alternative outlook, of a change of atmosphere of a diversion of effort, is essential.

data.Sentence_cn: 说实在的，把工作当作享受的那些人最需要每隔一段时间把工作从头脑中撇开。
data.Sentence: Indeed, it may well be that those whose work is their pleasure are those who most need the means of banishing it at intervals from their minds.
